eventDetails.keyword: Deepak Menon Film Showing and Conversations, CHAI house,
eventDetails.title: Deepak Menon Film Showing and Conversations
eventDetails.short_description: Come meet Deepak Menon, one of the most influential independent Tamil film director in Malaysia....
eventDetails.descripton:
Come meet Deepak Menon, one of the most influential independent Tamil film director in Malaysia. Watch the screenings of his films. Afterward, have a chat with him, his mother Sooria Kumari, a retired Tamil school teacher and the co-writer of his film Chemman Chaalai and some of the cast most of whom were amateurs.

8.30pm, Saturday, May 7
Chemman Chaalai (The Gravel Road)
- Chemman Chaalai is a drama set in the 1960s in a rubber estate in Malaysia. The story revolves around Shanta and her rubber tappers family living in the estate. Shantha aspires to leave the estate and further her studies. However, due to many unfortunate circumstances this dream becomes a difficult one to achieve.

Director's Note
Malaysian Indians have little control on the economy and politics in Malaysia. A way forward would be education. The film emphases the importance of education for the growth of the community and nation.

8.30pm, Sunday, May 8
Chalanggai (Dancing Bells)
- Uma lives with her mother, Muniammah, and elder brother Siva, in a soon to be demolished neighborhood secluded in the backyards of the rapidly developing Brickfields. Chalanggai is a beautifully realistic and detailed portrait of a family that has to survive and above all has to maintain its dignity. The film was shot entirely on location in Brickfield and the cast is made up of local amateurs.

address_details.venue_address: CHAI House, No 6, Jalan 6/3, Off Jalan Templer, PJ

eventDetails.price: FREE entry for Ladies / RM35 Men (Inc 1 drink)

eventDetails.title: Miri International Jazz Festival Preview
eventDetails.short_description: A preview of the festival, right here in the Klang Valley. Featuring an awesome mash up of musical talents, the night will start will songstress...
eventDetails.descripton:
It's finally here. The Miri International Jazz Festival make its highly anticipated return. To whet your appetite, Laundry Bar brings to you a preview of the festival, right here in the Klang Valley.

Featuring an awesome mash up of musical talents, the night will start will songstress Diandra Arjunaidi, followed by Isaac Entry and Jeremy Tordjman (pic). Catch these amazing talents in action live at Laundry Bar on May 7, 9.30pm.

address_details.venue_address: Laundry Bar, Lot 72, 73 & 74, 152 Ground floor Western Courtyard, The Curve Shopping Centre, No. 6 PJU 7/3, Mutiara Damansara 47800 PJ

eventDetails.title: Flash presents DJ Marcel Woods
eventDetails.short_description: Calling all trance lovers. Friday Flash presents you DJ Marcel Woods (DUTCH), head honcho of Musical Madness label...
eventDetails.descripton:
Calling all trance lovers. Friday Flash presents you DJ Marcel Woods (DUTCH), head honcho of Musical Madness label.

All the way from Netherlands Woods recently played both the White and Black editions of that country's famous Sensation parties. Woods is rightly proud of the invitation to play both, as it underlines his resistance to categorisation, and the versatility of his DJ-ing style. Listen to any of his twelve's and you'll realise the depth of his production style.

For all house lovers, you know where to be! For reservation, call 012 690 8196.

address_details.venue_address: Maison KL, No 8 Jalan Yap Ah Shak, Kuala Lumpur

eventDetails.price: FREE entry for Ladies / RM35 Men (Inc 1 drink)

eventDetails.keyword: Around Town listings, May 2010, Exhibitions, Expos, KL, Jobs, DB, Career, KLCC, Architectural
eventDetails.title: JobsDB Career Expo 2010
eventDetails.short_description: Left out of work by recession? Fresh graduate? Then prep your CV for the JobsDB Career Expo. JobsDB claims that this will be...
eventDetails.descripton: Left out of work by recession? Fresh graduate? Then prep your CV for the JobsDB Career Expo. JobsDB claims that this will be the best careers fair Malaysia has seen. They can't guarantee that you'll walk away with a job though.

address_details.venue_address: Hall 3-5, Kuala Lumpur Convention Centre, Jalan Pinang, KL

eventDetails.short_description: Prices start as low as RM1 for this regular used books sale. There will be a selection of children and teen's books, non-fiction...
eventDetails.descripton: Prices start as low as RM1 for this regular used books sale. There will be a selection of children and teen's books, non-fiction and paperback fiction.
